The shaded region is composed of four quarter-circles. Each quarter-circle has a radius of 1 unit. The area of each quarter-circle is $\frac{1}{4}\pi(1^2) = \frac{\pi}{4}$. Since there are four quarter-circles, the total area of the shaded region is $4 \times \frac{\pi}{4} = \pi$.

inference:
The shaded region is a square with side length 2.  The area of the square is $2^2 = 4$.
The area of the four quarter-circles is $4 \times \frac{1}{4}\pi(1^2) = \pi$.
The area of the shaded region is the area of the square minus the area of the four quarter-circles, which is $4 - \pi$.
